topic_metadata.title: Why doesn't `smallcaps` work for Libertinus Serif?

posts.name: XIONG
posts.cooked:
Hi, I find the #smallcaps function does not work on my MacBook (macOS 15.4.1 (24E263)). I‚Äôve tried Typst 0.13.1 in the terminal and VS code Tinymist
0.13.12, and they both compiled a pdf like this:

#smallcaps[Smallcaps]

#smallcaps[Libertinus Serif]

#text(font: "New Computer Modern", features: ("smcp",), [New Computer Modern])

image1250√ó296 63.4 KB

I guess this may result from the font ‚ÄúLibertinus Serif‚Äù, but the web editor typst.app (compile Typst 0.13.1) works well:

image2196√ó282 80.4 KB

What can I do to address this issue? If any addition information needed, please tell me.
Thanks for you help in advance!
posts.raw:
Hi, I find the `#smallcaps` function does not work on my MacBook (macOS 15.4.1 (24E263)). I've tried Typst 0.13.1 in the terminal and VS code Tinymist 
0.13.12, and they both compiled a pdf like this:
```typst
#smallcaps[Smallcaps]

#smallcaps[Libertinus Serif]

#text(font: "New Computer Modern", features: ("smcp",), [New Computer Modern])
```

![image|690x163](upload://bwKs9fJFGIPq86c6ZC7NwFjhBhC.png)

I guess this may result from the font "Libertinus Serif", but the web editor `typst.app` (compile Typst 0.13.1) works well:

![image|690x88](upload://un0cd0uil7oBNeI9ZgmCv5zlT8U.png)

What can I do to address this issue? If any addition information needed, please tell me. üòä
Thanks for you help in advance! ‚òïÔ∏è

posts.cooked:
Interesting. I‚Äôm on macOS 15.4.1, using VSCode + Tinymist 0.13.12 and the following input works just fine:

#smallcaps[Test]

Ie. I get smallcaps. I‚Äôd first try reinstalling Tinymist. Maybe even remove Typst installation if you also have that. Just to make sure it uses the latest version and there are no odd font conflicts. Also make sure you have not installed a font with similar name manually to Font Book.

But, I‚Äôm just guessing and throwing ideas. Have not encountered this.
posts.raw:
Interesting. I'm on macOS 15.4.1, using VSCode + Tinymist 0.13.12 and the following input works just fine:

```typ
#smallcaps[Test]
```

Ie. I get smallcaps. I'd first try reinstalling Tinymist. Maybe even remove Typst installation if you also have that. Just to make sure it uses the latest version and there are no odd font conflicts. Also make sure you have not installed a font with similar name manually to Font Book.

But, I'm just guessing and throwing ideas. Have not encountered this.

posts.cooked:
Hi @XIONG, welcome to the Typst forum! I‚Äôve updated your question title to follow our guidelines.

Maybe you have a local version of Libertinus Serif that doesn‚Äôt include the smallcaps? Can you try to compile the document with typst compile --ignore-system-fonts file.typ ?

See here for more details on Typst‚Äôs font handling.
posts.raw:
Hi @XIONG, welcome to the Typst forum! I've updated your question title to follow our [guidelines](https://forum.typst.app/t/how-to-post-in-the-questions-category/11).

Maybe you have a local version of Libertinus Serif that doesn't include the smallcaps? Can you try to compile the document with `typst compile  --ignore-system-fonts file.typ` ?

See [here](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/text/#parameters-font) for more details on Typst's font handling.

posts.name: XIONG
posts.cooked:
sijo:

here

Thank you for your reply! You‚Äôre right. After I removed my local Libertinus Serif, smallcaps() works.
posts.raw:
[quote="sijo, post:3, topic:3893"]
[here ](https://typst.app/docs/reference/text/text/#parameters-font)
[/quote]

Thank you for your reply! You're right. After I removed my local `Libertinus Serif`, `smallcaps()` works. üòä

posts.name: XIONG
posts.cooked: Thank you for your reply! You‚Äôre right. smallcaps() works now.
posts.raw: Thank you for your reply! You're right. `smallcaps()` works now. üòä

posts.name: XIONG
posts.cooked: In addition, I find that I should install ‚Äô.otf‚Äô file rather than ‚Äò.ttf‚Äô. ‚Äô.otf‚Äô local font file supports ‚Äòsmallcaps‚Äô :)
posts.raw: In addition, I find that I should install ‚Äô.otf‚Äô file rather than ‚Äò.ttf‚Äô. ‚Äô.otf‚Äô local font file supports ‚Äòsmallcaps‚Äô :)
